i1.name: King's Tribute
i1.blurb: When an enemy unit dies near Trundle, he {{tip|heal|heals}} for a percent of its maximum Health.
i1.description: {{sbc|Innate:}} Whenever an enemy dies near '''Trundle''', he {{tip|heal|heals}} for {{as|{{sti|health|{{pp|5|key=%|2 to 6|1;5;9;12;15}} of their '''maximum''' health}}}}.
notes: * [[Monster|Neutral monster]] deaths will trigger ''King's Tribute'', even if their killer was an enemy.
* ''King's Tribute'' does not trigger when an enemy structure is destroyed.

riot.name: Chomp
riot.description: Trundle bites his opponent, dealing damage, briefly slowing and sapping some of their Attack Damage.
riot.tooltip:
Trundle lunges at his opponent with his next basic attack, dealing {{ e1 }} (+{{ f1 }}) physical damage and briefly slowing his target.

This attack increases Trundle's Attack Damage by {{ e3 }} for {{ e6 }} seconds, with his opponent losing half of this amount.

q1.name: Chomp
q1.blurb: Trundle bites his opponent, dealing damage, briefly slowing and sapping some of their Attack Damage.
q1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Trundle's''' next [[basic attack]] deals {{tip|physical damage|{{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}}} and {{tip|slow|slows}} his target by 75% for {{fd|0.1}} seconds.
q1.description2: After biting his target, '''Trundle''' gains {{as|'''bonus''' attack damage}} for 5 seconds and reduces his target's {{as|attack damage}} by half that amount for the same duration.
notes: * The triggering attack will apply other [[on-hit effect]]s and can {{tip|critical strike|critically strike}} as normal.
** As with most on-hit physical damage, the bonus damage from ''Chomp'' will apply {{sti|life steal}}.
** {{tip|critical strike|Critical strikes}} will not interact with the bonus damage from ''Chomp''.

** ''Chomp's''  will still incur the attack damage increase/decrease if Trundle's attack is {{ai|Aegis Protection|Pantheon|blocked}}, {{ai|Counter Strike|Jax|dodged}}, {{ai|Riposte|Fiora|parried}} or if ''Trundle'' is {{tip|blind|blinded}}.

riot.tooltip: Trundle coats target location with ice for {{ e4 }} seconds, gaining {{ e1 }}% Movement Speed, {{ e2 }}% Attack Speed and {{ e3 }}% increased healing and regeneration from all sources.

w1.name: Frozen Domain
w1.blurb: Trundle turns target location into his domain, gaining Attack Speed, Movement Speed, and increased healing from all sources while on it.
w1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Trundle''' coats the target area in ice for 8 seconds. While inside, he gains {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' attack speed}}}}, {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}}, and 25% increased [[healing|health restoration]] from all sources.
w1.leveling:
{{st|Bonus Attack Speed|{{ap|20 to 100}}%}}
{{st|Bonus Movement Speed|{{ap|20 to 40}}%}}
notes: *''Frozen Domain'' has no cast time and does not interrupt Trundle's previous orders.

riot.name: Pillar of Ice
riot.description: Trundle creates an ice pillar at target location, becoming impassable terrain and slowing all nearby enemy units.
riot.tooltip: Trundle creates an icy pillar at target location for {{ e1 }} seconds, becoming impassable terrain and slowing all nearby enemy units by {{ e2 }}%.

e1.name: Pillar of Ice
e1.blurb: Trundle creates an ice pillar at target location, becoming impassable terrain and slowing all nearby enemy units.
e1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Trundle''' projects a pillar of ice at the target location for 6 seconds, {{tip|airborne|knocking back}} everyone directly over it 225 units on cast, acting as impassable terrain for the duration and {{tip|slow|slowing}} enemies around it.
notes: * ''Pillar of Ice'' can knock back allied units.

* ''Pillar of Ice'' cannot be placed inside impassable terrain. Attempting to do so will cause the pillar to spawn in the nearest available spot of accessible terrain, similar to {{ii|Warding Totem|wards}} and pets such as {{cai|Yordle Snap Trap|Caitlyn}}.
* ''Pillar Of Ice'' triggers in-combat effects such as drawing turret aggro, applying {{ii|Elixir of Sorcery}} and {{ri|Sudden Impact}}.
* ''Pillar of Ice'' is able to interrupt both ally and enemy {{si|Recall}}.

riot.name: Subjugate
riot.description: Trundle immediately steals a percent of his target's Health, Armor and Magic Resistance. Over the next 4 seconds the amount of Health, Armor, and Magic Resistance stolen is doubled.
riot.tooltip: Trundle drains {{ totalpercenthpdamage }} of an enemy champion's maximum Health as Magic Damage and {{ armormrshred*100 }}% of their Armor and Magic Resist, half immediately and half over {{ actualdurationofdrainbuff }} seconds. The Armor and Magic Resist is returned {{ durationofdrainfortooltip }} seconds after the drain ends.

r1.name: Subjugate
r1.blurb: Trundle immediately steals a percent of his target's Health, Armor and Magic Resistance. Over the next 4 seconds the amount of Health, Armor, and Magic Resistance stolen is doubled.
r1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} After {{fd|0.5}} seconds, '''Trundle''' starts draining the life force out of the target enemy [[champion]], {{tip|heal|healing}} for a percentage of {{as|the target's '''maximum''' health}}, dealing the same amount as {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}} and stealing {{sti|armor|{{as|40% of their armor}}}} and {{sti|mr|{{as|magic resistance}}}}. Half of the total [[damage]] and stealing is applied instantly, and the other half is applied over the next 4 seconds.
r1.leveling: {{st|Total Magic Damage|{{as|{{ap|20 to 35 3}}% {{as|(+ 2% per 100 AP)}} of the target's '''maximum''' health|health}}|Initial Magic Damage|{{as|{{ap|20/2 to 35/2 3}}% {{as|(+ 1% per 100 AP)}} of the target's '''maximum''' health|health}}|Magic Damage Per Second|{{as|{{ap|20/8 to 35/8 3}}% {{as|(+ {{fd|0.25}}% per 100 AP)}} of the target's '''maximum''' health|health}}}}
r1.description2: The armor and magic resist will remain stolen for 4 seconds after the drain has ended.
notes: * The total value of armor, magic resist and damage that will be dealt is determined ''at the point of cast''. Temporary boosts/reductions in resistances or health will affect those values if they are active before cast, but will not affect those values if they come into effect afterwards.
